'''Sedūzo''' is a character in {{poe2}}.

## Background

{{Description|This Rauataian sits ramrod-straight. On the table near her are a half-empty liquor bottle and a small porcelain cup. Both smell of anise.

She looks like she's trying to blend in, but her unnatural stillness - and her bright, spotless attire - make her stand out like a reef fish against the rocks.}}
Captain Sedūzo isn't big on cultural exchange or tolerance - especially not after her latest run-in with [Botaro](/botaro/). When the Rauatai empire finally expands into the Deadfire and they all pay homage to the ranga nui, they will have to accept their customs, after all.

Until then, she will continue to use her old travel routes. Her latest trips saw her exchange a consignment of iron and cultured coral for vorlas, murkberries, and Ondra's Stars.

## Interactions

{{Interactions
|companion       =
|wares           =
|stronghold      =
|rest            =
|quests_started  =
|quests_involved = [All Aboard](/allAboard/)
|none            = 
|other           = * When you first talk to her, Sedūzo asks [Harami](/harami/) if she's expecting a merchant from the Watcher's set culture (e.g Dyrwood, Old Vailia).
* With [Streetwise](/streetwise/) 4, [Insight](/insight/) 3 or [History](/history/) 2 you can question her presence in the slums, though she doesn't reveal anything.
}}

## =Quests

=
* [All Aboard](/allAboard/): Sedūzo can give passage to Biha and her children - if you get the other problems out of the way.
[Category:The Gullet characters](/categoryTheGulletCharacters/)
[Category:The Hole characters](/categoryTheHoleCharacters/)

'''Sedūzo''' is a character in {{poe2}}.

==Background==
{{Description|This Rauataian sits ramrod-straight. On the table near her are a half-empty liquor bottle and a small porcelain cup. Both smell of anise.

She looks like she's trying to blend in, but her unnatural stillness - and her bright, spotless attire - make her stand out like a reef fish against the rocks.}}
Captain Sedūzo isn't big on cultural exchange or tolerance - especially not after her latest run-in with [[Botaro]]. When the Rauatai empire finally expands into the Deadfire and they all pay homage to the ranga nui, they will have to accept their customs, after all.

Until then, she will continue to use her old travel routes. Her latest trips saw her exchange a consignment of iron and cultured coral for vorlas, murkberries, and Ondra's Stars.
